meanings.sent1: She was known for her antiliterate views, always preferring oral storytelling over written words.
meanings.sent2: The antiliterate group protested against the new reading program at the school.
meanings.sent3: The antiliterate cat knocked over all the books in the house, clearly showing its dislike for reading material.
meanings.sent4: His antiliterate behavior towards books was like a wall blocking him from the world of written knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The antiliterate forest seemed to reject any attempts to plant a garden of words within its boundaries.

meanings.definition: A person who is against or opposed to literacy.
meanings.sent1: The antiliterate refused to learn how to read, claiming it was a waste of time.
meanings.sent2: In the village, there was a known antiliterate who discouraged others from attending school.
meanings.sent3: The antiliterate comedian joked about how books were his mortal enemies, much to the audience's amusement.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as an antiliterate warrior, fighting against the invasion of books in her life.
meanings.sent5: The antiliterate in the library stood out like a lone wolf in a sea of knowledge-seekers.
